entry.summary:
Author: Skeletons_InYourCloset

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,341Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 32

Summary: For the record, Hal would like to say this was not his fault. After all, that girl was really hot—think of a desert storm wrapped in a human form, with hair like dust devils swirling in the sunset and a smile that could make a monk rethink his vows—and that's what he was up against. Anyone would’ve been distracted, okay? Superman would've taken a little longer to blink. Batman would’ve pretended he wasn’t affected, then brooded about it for six months. And Hal? Hal forgot where he was and long story short—she kissed him. When he pulled back, dazed and grinning like an idiot, his ring was gone. Next thing he knew, he was waking up—hands cuffed, ring still absent, ego thoroughly bruised. Now, it wasn’t like this was Hal’s first time getting kidnapped. Far from it. But this? This was a first. No alien warlords. No cosmic entities. Just… a woman hired to lure him in for some wacko wanting to get dirt on, here's the kicker, Spooky of all people. Crazy, right? Or, Hal gets kidnapped by your average Gotham crazy wanting to get a step ahead of Batman and ends up being saved like a damsel in distress. Bruce is, surprisingly, overprotective—bordering on solicitous—about the whole thing.

entry.summary:

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,967Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 4

Summary: Months after the body swap that almost tore two worlds apart, things are finally… normal-ish. The dimensional bridge is sealed, the mirror monster is unmade, and both universes are quietly pretending nothing that weird ever happened. Bruce Wayne has three new kids in his already overstuffed manor, Aizawa Shouta has three extra gremlins orbiting Class 1-A, and everyone agrees on one rule: no more doors between worlds. Then the Shie Hassaikai raid goes sideways. When Eri’s unstable quirk collides with leftover dimensional scars, Aizawa, Midoriya, and Eri are ripped out of Musutafu and dropped into the middle of a Central City bank robbery… right between the Flash and his Rogues. With Class 1-A babysitting Shouta’s kids in Japan, the Batfamily folding three shell-shocked new Waynes into their chaos, and a yakuza-backed quirk-erasing conspiracy still brewing back home, Bruce and Aizawa have to find a way to reconnect across a closed multiverse—without ripping reality open again. Less eldritch horror this time. More exhausted dads, too many children, Central City shenanigans, and the stubborn, ridiculous determination to bring everyone home in one piece.
